Job Title: Distribution Center Supervisor - St. Louis, MO

Location: St Louis, MO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
At STERIS, we help our Customers create a healthier and safer world by providing innovative healthcare and life science product and service solutions around the globe.

The Role 

The Distribution Center Supervisor is responsible for ensuring safe, timely, cost-effective receiving, and shipping of finished goods. In this role, the Distribution Center Supervisor will ensure high levels of customer service and satisfaction by coordinating supply chain activities with the Manufacturing, Planning and Sourcing groups. In addition, you will maintain appropriate and accurate record keeping and data management systems and is an effective liaison with transportation providers and internal and external customers.

What You Will Do

Ensure proper operation of equipment by training operators on equipment use, requisitioning needed equipment maintenance, and ensuring equipment is maintained in a clean working order.Establish, maintain, and promote positive employee relations, while maintaining productivity, attendance, and general order required for an efficient operation. Ensure daily cycle counts are taken and provide Senior Distribution Manager/Director with monthly reports on outcome.Work with cross functional groups to ensure traffic between warehouse points and customers is coordinated and managed optimally.Assists in the establishment of performance objectives. Promotes positive employee relations. Maintains training matrix and ensures employees are up to date on these requirements.Responsible for receipt of finished goods and/or shipments to domestic and international customers and distributors.Coordinate activities and provide direction to employees in charge of daily operations.Develop and/or maintain the required material handling procedures and work instructions for the department.Ensure required daily production requirements are aligned with Customer requirements.Maintain and supervise appropriate inventory record keeping. Provide input for warehouse design and logistics.Maintain a safe working environment by instructing employees on established safety practices and enforcing practices at all times. Ensure that emergency equipment, electrical panels, and exits are regularly monitored and free from obstructions.Coordinate and lead special projects affecting domestic warehouse operations.Maintain 5S/SQDC boards and implement Lean initiatives to improve productivity. 

What You Will Need to be Successful

Bachelor's Degree in related field. In lieu of a degree, High School Diploma, or equivalent, and 5-10 years warehouse experience.Minimum (3) years related supervisory or leadership experience (warehousing, domestic transportation and shipping/receiving). Effective time management and ability to respond to shifting priorities. Ability to work effectively against deadlines and handle several tasks/projects simultaneously while meeting or exceeding performance standards

Preferred Experience

Experience working in an FDA controlled facility.2-3 years of experience working with Lean concepts in an operations, distribution center, logistics or warehouse environment.Experience with handling, storing, and shipping hazardous materials.

Skills

Demonstrated ability to work effectively and react appropriately with shifting priorities and rapid change.Demonstrated high level of performance, professionalism, confidentiality, and integrity.

What STERIS Will Offer You

The opportunity to join a company that will invest in you for the long-term. STERIS couldn’t be where it is today without our incredible people. That’s why we share in our success together by rewarding you for your hard work. Hiring people who are in it for the long run with STERIS is our ultimate goal. We do this by providing competitive salaries, healthcare benefits, tuition assistance, paid time off, holidays, matching 401(k), annual merit, and incentive plans. Join us and help write our next chapter.

STERIS is a leading global provider of products and services that support patient care with an emphasis on infection prevention. WE HELP OUR CUSTOMERS CREATE A HEALTHIER AND SAFER WORLD by providing innovative healthcare, life sciences and dental products and services. STERIS is a $5 billion, publicly traded (NYSE: STE) company with approximately 17,000 associates and Customers in more than 100 countries.

If you need assistance completing the application process, please call 1 (440) 392.7047. This contact information is for accommodation inquiries only and cannot be used to check application status.

STERIS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and the use of affirmative action programs to ensure that persons are recruited, hired, trained, transferred and promoted in all job groups regardless of race, color, religion, age, disability, national origin, citizenship status, military or veteran status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, and any other category protected by federal, state or local law. We are not only committed to this policy by our status as a federal government contractor, but also we are strongly bound by the principle of equal employment opportunity.

The full affirmative action program, absent the data metrics required by

60-741.44(k), shall be available to all employees and applicants for employment for inspection upon request. The program may be obtained at your location’s HR Office during normal business hours.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
